title: 93/74/EEC: Commission Decision of 21 December 1992 concerning the status of Denmark with regard to infectious hematopoietic necrosis and viral haemorrhagic septicaemia
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 21 December 1992 concerning the status of Denmark with regard to infectious hematopoietic necrosis and viral haemorrhagic septicemia
(93/74/EEC)THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Denmark is recognized as approved continental zone and approved coastal zone for fish with regard to infectious hematopoietic necrosis.

The part of Denmark composed of the water catchment to areas contained in the Annex, and the coastal areas belonging thereto, is recognized as approved continental zone and approved coastal zone for fish with regard to viral haemorrhagic  septicemia.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 21 December 1992.
For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 46, 19. 2. 1991, p. 1.
